entries.meaning: (business) The development and use of a system for recording and analyzing the financial transactions and financial status of an individual or a business.
A relaying of events; justification of actions.
examples: He was required to give a thorough accounting of his time.

entries.meaning: (law) An equitable remedy requiring wrongfully obtained profits to be distributed to those who deserve them.
examples: In contrast, an accounting for profits, or accounting— a distinct form of relief that the majority groups with disgorgement — has a well-accepted definition: It compels a defendant to account for, and repay to a plaintiff, those profits that belong to the plaintiff in equity.
